page.title: 08THE FAIR, LINCOLN.
page.content: This year{1985 Lincoln Fair celebrated {its 300th anniversary of the granting {of a charter by Charles II}, to hold an annual fair.The showmen gave to the city four {Maundy coins}minted in{1684 and also free rides for two hours to disabled and handicapped children.The fair has been held twice a year on the {South Common} since{ 1943.}This year there were{ 78}stallholders,{18}large riding machines,{21 }other rides,{47 side stalls and {99}living vans.This year it costs {Â£156 rent}for a large riding machine,{Â£58 }for the helter skelter, and the maximum for a hot dog stall, depending on size and position, {Â£26.50.}The oldest ride was the Galloping Horses and next the Cake Walk which was{70 years}old.The newest ride was the Tip Top.
